text: Martina Hingis was the defending champion, but did not compete this year. Amélie Mauresmo won the title by defeating Sandrine Testud 6–4, 7–6(7–3) in the final. ==Seeds== The first four seeds received a bye into the second round. ==Draw== ===Finals=== ===Top Half=== ===Bottom Half=== ==References== * Official results archive (ITF) * Official results archive (WTA) Dubai Duty Free Women's Open - Singles Singles
title: 2002 Dubai Duty Free Women's Open – Singles
